    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The Camp Nou was the stage for an exhilarating match between Barcelona and Osasuna, which ended with a resounding 7-1 victory for the home side. From the moment the first whistle blew, the game pulsated with energy, skill, and an overwhelming showcase of Barcelona's dominance.

**First Half:**

Barcelona kicked off the match with intent at 00:00. Within a minute, the ball was out of play, signifying the beginning of a tightly contested battle. Osasuna managed a clearance at 01:18, reflecting the early pressure they were under. Another clearance at 02:25 and several more throw-ins by Barcelona signaled their relentless attacking approach.

Osasuna appeared a little reactionary, with another clearance at 06:44. It was only 10 minutes in, but Barcelona was controlling the tempo, causing the visitors to backpedal and clear their lines often. Their persistence paid off when Lionel Messi broke the deadlock at the 11:44 mark. His brilliant solo effort saw him skip past a couple of defenders and deftly chip the ball over the advancing Salvatore Sirigu, making it 1-0. A magnificent goal showcasing Messi at his sublime best.

Osasuna responded with a kick-off at 12:41 but found themselves under constant pressure from Barcelona. By 13:48, Barcelona had their next shot on target, signifying the relentless offensive from the home side. Lucas Digne came close with a volley from the edge of the penalty box, but a defender's block resulted in a corner. This corner, taken by Ivan Rakitic, didn't produce a goal, but Barcelona's intent was clear—they were hunting for more.

Ivan Rakitic’s corner kicks continued to trouble Osasuna's defense, with a hurried clearance at 15:24 being a testament to the threats mounted. Barcelona appeared relentless in their attacks, first with Messi missing by inches with his shot near the 25th minute, followed shortly by another clearance from the visitors reflecting the siege they were under.

Barcelona's continuous pressing bore fruit again when, at the 29:34 mark, Andre Gomes unleashed a first-time shot from inside the box to beat the goalkeeper and make it 2-0. The build-up to the goal was a hallmark of Barcelona’s play—quick, precise, and deadly. The celebration was short, though, with Osasuna resuming at 30:31.

Despite brief respites characterized by throw-ins and clearances, Osasuna's moments of possession were limited. Every time they managed to get the ball out of play, Barcelona quickly transitioned into another attack. One such moment came at 36:36 when Salvatore Sirigu had to watch Javier Mascherano put a cross towards Arda Turan, whose header went well wide of the left post.

Even as the first half neared its end, Barcelona's grip on the match never loosened. Osasuna managed occasional forays and won a few throw-ins, but by the 44th minute, when Sergio Leon and Antonio Fausto's two-yard passes were intercepted by Barcelona’s defense, the half’s narrative was set. The referee’s whistle at 45:03 confirmed Barcelona's dominance as they walked off the field leading 2-0.

**Second Half:**

As the second half commenced, Osasuna showed early signs of fight. A mere two minutes in, Roberto Torres scored a superb free-kick placing the ball into the left post to make it 2-1—a glimmer of hope for the visitors. It was a perfect strike, executed with precision and curl that evaded the keeper. Barcelona, undeterred, responded promptly, resuming their fierce attack with more shots on target and corners. 

Barcelona’s renewed vigor post the Osasuna goal was evident by 04:30, with Ivan Rakitic again taking the corner. Javier Mascherano’s subsequent header required Sirigu to deflect it onto the post in what's a heroic piece of goalkeeping.

The 11:45-minute mark saw Barcelona extend their lead once more when Andre Gomes fired the rebound into the bottom right corner. The goal was courtesy of a failed clearance by Osasuna, allowing Gomes to pounce and convert. The score now stood at 3-1, and the floodgates seemed prime to open.

Osasuna’s continuous kick-offs did little to disrupt Barcelona’s rhythm. Another superb moment came at 15:06 with Lionel Messi receiving a pinpoint pass and striking a powerful shot that went inside the right post, further intensifying the crowd's exhilaration. At 4-1, Osasuna's defense looked shaken.

By 17:13, Messi walked off the pitch to a standing ovation, replaced by Carles Alena. Messi’s substitution came amid chants of his name—evidence of the splendid display of genius he'd put on.

Paco Alcacer added another goal to Barcelona’s tally at 18:58, making it 5-1 after lifting the ball effortlessly over Salvatore Sirigu from inside the box—a statement of composure and sharpness in the finish.

Amid this goal fest, Javier Mascherano also got on the scoresheet at the 21:50 mark. Having been fouled in the box, a penalty was awarded, and Mascherano coolly dispatched the ball with a shot into the roof of the net. At 6-1, Barcelona were unstoppable, cementing the one-sided nature of the matchup.

Osasuna attempted to find some solace with substitutions, Jaime Romero replaced by Miguel Olavide, and Sergio Leon by Kenan Kodro, but Barcelona kept up their relentless assault on the goal with numerous corners and shots.

Another notable substitution saw Fran Merida replaced by Goran Causic at 33:44. Barcelona's offensive barrage continued with Denis Suarez showcasing terrific vision to find Paco Alcacer for another goal at 40:15. Alcacer displayed impeccable composure to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net, bringing the score to 7-1.

Barcelona continued to dominate possession and control the ball in Osasuna’s half. Even as they neared full-time, the home side was pushing for more. Carles Alena had an effort go over the bar just before the announcement of the attendance—63,989 fans witnessing this masterclass.

The referee's final whistle at 47:00 confirmed a comprehensive victory for Barcelona. It was a night of exhilarating football, tactical supremacy, and a masterful exhibition of skill from Lionel Messi and his teammates. Osasuna, despite their valiant attempts, were completely outclassed by a Barcelona side in supreme form. The standout performances from Messi, Andre Gomes, and Paco Alcacer were highlights in an unforgettable clash at Camp Nou.
